This calendar lists all of the readings, assignments, and activities for the class. Remember that material needs to be read, and assignments completed prior to the class meeting they are listed for. For your convenience, I list the information for the upcoming class meeting at the top of the page, but consult the full schedule below to get a sense of whatâ€™s coming up in the weeks ahead.

Monday August 24

  • Read:
  • Class Activity: Discuss class teaching style, goals, and syllabus.
  • Assignment Due:

    • Wednesday August 26

  • Read:
    • Selections from "In The Beginning Was The Command Line"
  • Class Activity: Discuss Stephenson's analysis of computer interfaces. What are the limitations of graphical user interfaces, according to Stephenson? Why does he think that professionals use language-based interfaces (the command line and code). What do you think? How have you noticed the limits of GUIs in your own experience? What excites you about learning code? What advantages might it bring you? What worries you or frightens you about learning code?
  • Assignment Due:

    • Friday August 28

  • Read:
    • Mozilla Developer's Network(MDN): Intro to HTML
  • Class Activity: QUIZ: Basic tag syntax and HTML terminology. In class tagging exercises using CodePen
  • Assignment Due: Sign up for a free Code Pen account prior to class today and email a link to your account page to the instructor.

    • Monday August 31

  • Read:
    • Nesting
    • HTML Dog: Lists
    • MDN: <ul> - HTML
  • Class Activity: QUIZ: Lists and Nesting. Code Pen exercises on nested elements and tagging. Discussion of how to read MDN documentation pages.
  • Assignment Due:

    • Wednesday September 2

  • Read:
    • HTML Dog: Tags, Attributes and Elements
    • MDN: <a> - HTML
    • MDN: Global Attributes
  • Class Activity: QUIZ: Attributes and tags. Code Pen exercises on links, link attributes (href and target), and the id and class attributes.
  • Assignment Due:

    • Monday September 14

  • Read:
    • MDN: Heading Elements - HTML
  • Class Activity: Exercise: use your knowledge of html to create a valid html version of a text resume provided by the instructor.
  • Assignment Due:

    • Wednesday September 16

  • Read:
    • Visual Hierarchy
  • Class Activity: Discuss visual hierarchy. We'll use your html resume from last class as an example. What are some effective things your html resume does to establish visual hierarchy? How might it be improved? We'll also discuss the inpiration notebook assignment.
  • Assignment Due: Complete your html resume, validate it, and post it to github pages.

    • Friday September 18

  • Read:
    • MDN: What is CSS?
    • MDN: Why use CSS?
    • MDN: Cascading and Inheritance
    • MDN: Selectors
  • Class Activity: QUIZ: Basic CSS syntax and HTML syntax review. In class exercise: start using basic CSS. Explore the three ways we can include CSS information in web documents, and explain the uses for each. Review the class and id attributes and see how we can use them to select elements for styling.
  • Assignment Due:

    • Monday September 21

  • Read:
    • MDN: Text styles
    • MDN: Color
  • Class Activity: Use CSS text styles and color to improve the html resume from last week.
  • Assignment Due:

    • Wednesday September 23

  • Read:
    • CSS: Block vs Inline Display Styles
    • MDN: Boxes
    • MDN: Layout
  • Class Activity: QUIZ: CSS color and text formatting properties. In-class exercises on the box model and basic layout in CSS.
  • Assignment Due: Inspiration Notebook 1 (color and typeface contrast, visual hierarchy)
